abstract: Deutsche Bank announces sweeping plan in response to tense regulatory atmosphere in United States that will reduce its dependence on borrowed money and shrink its investment bank, raising question of whether it can compete with big US banks; co-chief executives Anshu Jain and Jurgen Fitschen insist that they are still committed to idea of universal bank.
lead_paragraph: The lender said it would reduce its dependence on borrowed money, sell its German retail branches on the stock market and shrink its investment bank.

headline.main: Deutsche Bank Shakes Up Its Business, and Maybe Its Identity
headline.print_headline: Deutsche to Shrink Investment Bank, but Vows to Remain a Global Force

snippet: The lender said it would reduce its dependence on borrowed money, sell its German retail branches on the stock market and shrink its investment bank.
